questions.question: She was hungry ………………………… she hadn’t eaten anything in a long time.
questions.description: Because gives the reason for something.

questions.question: ……………………………… he is late, we will go without him.
questions.description: Either could be used here with different meanings. If expresses a condition. As gives the reason.

questions.question: …………………………… he is fat, he runs slowly.
He is neither intelligent …………………………….. hard working.
I can’t talk to you now ………………………….. I am busy.
questions.description: Because gives the reason for something.

questions.question: You can watch TV …………………………….. you have finished your homework.
……………………………. you are feeling cold, I will put the heating on.
………………………………… I had a headache, I enjoyed the party.
questions.description: Even though is used to emphasize a contrast.

questions.question: He spoke so fast ………………………….. I could not follow him.
questions.description: So shows the cause and that indicates the effect.

questions.question: The faster you run, …………………………. you get tired.
questions.description: The comparative is used in both clauses in this structure. The article 'the' cannot be omitted.

questions.question: …………………………. he is the fastest runner, he finished last.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: This is the house …………………………… I live.
